items.sentence: Tom wished there was something else he could do to help.
Tom wondered how much luggage Mary was planning to take.
Is there any part of my life Tom didn\'t tell you about?
Don\'t let yourself be provoked into losing your temper.
Don\'t you think we should let Tom do whatever he wants?
Don\'t you think we should let Tom try doing that again?
Did you know that Tom doesn\'t have a driver\'s license?
You should polish your shoes before you go to the party.
When I give you an order, I expect it to be carried out.
When I returned home, my brother was doing his homework.
When I was a student, I used to go to that pizza parlor.
I think you\'d better take an umbrella in case it rains.
Tom and Mary have known each other since they were kids.
Tom and Mary have one grandson and three granddaughters.
Tom and Mary held hands as they watched the fog roll in.
Tom and Mary looked at each other and then back at John.
Tom had no idea the police were watching his every move.
I was disappointed when I heard that you couldn\'t come.
I wasn\'t very interested in what Tom was talking about.
If you don\'t want to give a speech, you don\'t have to.
